My journey in Desire Foundation started in the year 2014; it was an enriching and wonderful experience throughout. We went to slums interacted with many people, the people who had suffered a lot in their life but still moving ahead with a hope, seeing their will to fight the odds and move ahead in life gave me hope, hope to fight the wrong, hope to live a meaningful life. It has had a great influence on my perceptions on life and I experienced that how happy we can become seeing beautiful smiles on those underprivileged faces .I am pleased to worked in such a friendly environment where each and every member puts whole heart and soul to reach their ultimate goal ” to transform lives of people on the edges of society and living in the most destitute areas.” Desire Foundation impressed me by its organizational structure which is a combination of government registered trust working in a corporate way. Being a part of Human Resource department, conducting events, arranging appointments and dealing with a plethora of individuals and corporate was a great exposure. The organization provided me a platform of not only immense learning but also contributing towards society. It was an overwhelming and life changing experience and I feel grateful to Desire Foundation for giving me this opportunity of working with them.

At last from my experience I would just like to say that never let your fear become your master, because the point where fear becomes the master is the point where you break.
